message.content: This question requires some basic knowledge about genetics and inheritance. A tiger with a stubby tail most likely had ancestors with that trait, as traits can be inherited from previous generations. Option (A) is incorrect because it refers to offspring, which may or may not inherit the trait. Option (C) is incorrect because siblings can have different traits depending on genetic variations. Option (D) is incorrect because it assumes that both parents have the long tail trait, which may not be the case.

Option (A) is incorrect because having children with long tails does not necessarily mean the tiger itself had a long-tailed parent. Option (C) is also incorrect because siblings can have different traits. Option (D) is incorrect because the tiger could have inherited the stubby tail from ancestors further back in its family tree, not necessarily from its parents.
